verbose_text: An important regulator of fatty acid metabolism is sterol regulatory element binding protein 1/2 (SREBP-1/2), which has been shown to activate transcription of enzymes, including ATP citrate lyase (ACLY), acetyl-CoA carboxylase 1 (ACC1), fatty acid synthase (FASN), elongation of very-long-chain fatty acids (ELOVL), SCD1, and the fatty acid transporter CD36.
evidence: sterol regulatory element-binding protein 1/2 (SREBP-1/2), which has been shown to activate transcription
